oldentry: Popular explanation: bringing two halves together to form a whole'
verblex: 1. To make a number of things or people come together in one place or within one organisation. English = group.
2. To make something which is fragmented or broken into a single, complete thing. English = make whole.
nomlex: 1. A number of people or things which are together at one place at one time. English = group.
2. A set of people or things which have something in common. English = group.
3. Something you can consider as a single, complete thing. English = unit, whole.
4. A group of people who work together at a specific job, often in a particular place. English = unit, team.
